page.title: 15QUEENSFERRY ROAD
page.content:
Our school, Clermiston, is very close to the Queensferry Road which goes from the city of Edinburgh to the Forth Road Bridge. Over the past ten years, since the road bridge was built, traffic has become heavier and heavier and the road is now the busiest in Scotland. Our class did a traffic survey on Thursday 23 May 1985 for 10 minutes around 1.30pm and then again around 2.30pm. Here are the results (traffic in both directions).
1.30pm { }2.30pm {Cars 342 405 {Buses 10 5 {Lorries/Vans 131 103 {2-wheeled transport 4 6 { This gives a projected figure of about 3000 vehicles an hour at a busy period making crossing the road hazardous.
